blockquote.p: The type common_comparison_category provides an alias for the strongest comparison category to which all of the template arguments can be converted.

discussion.p:
A naive reader like me might interpret this as meaning that (1) you attempt to convert the template arguments to comparison categories and then (2) obtain the strongest among them.
However, the intent is in fact to realize the common comparison type notion from /4. To obtain a non-void result, all the template arguments must be comparison categories, rather than convertible to comparison categories.
/2 mildly contradicts the first paragraph:

blockquote.p: Remarks: The member typedef-name type denotes the common comparison type () of Ts..., the expanded parameter pack, or void if any element of Ts is not a comparison category type.

discussion.p: Set priority to 3 after reflector poll.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4892.

p.del: -1- The type common_comparison_category provides an alias for the strongest comparison category to which all of the template arguments can be converted. [Note 1: A comparison category type is stronger than another if they are distinct types and an instance of the former can be converted to an instance of the latter. — end note]

blockquote.p: -2- Remarks: The member typedef-name type denotes the common comparison type () of Ts..., the expanded parameter pack, or void if any element of Ts is not a comparison category type.
